q: for actual evidence which reasonably leads to a conclusion that they are trying to build a bomb. Statements by Ms. Caroline Glick like the following are reminiscent of Colin Powell 's UN speech asserting that Iraq had WMDs. As IAEA head, Elbaradei shielded Iran's nuclear weapons program from the Security Council. He repeatedly ignored evidence indicating that Iran's nuclear program was a military program rather than a civilian energy program. When the evidence became too glaring to ignore, Elbaradei continued to lobby against significant UN Security Council sanctions or other actions against Iran and obscenely equated Israel's purported nuclear program to Iran's. So, without evidence, she has concluded that Iran has a bomb program, that Elbaradei shielded it, and that Israel, where evidence of the bomb is all but admtted, can't be compared

In his two television interviews on ABC News, Donald Rumsfeld displayed little recognition of personal responsibility for the war in Iraq. Everyone involved bears a responsibility for the conduct, Donald Rumsfeld told George Stephanopoulos on "Good Morning America" Tuesday. David Cameron is said to be so worried about the prospect of losing legislation in a parliamentary logjam that he held a series of meetings with MPs and peers last week described as a "charm offensive". The Prime Minister is definitely in listening mode as never before, said one Conservative David Cameron . "He is much more conciliatory, the mood music has completely changed." It is understood Mr Andy Coulson first informed the Prime Minister of his intention to leave last Wednesday before

other during a conference call with analysts, with Eric Schmidt describing Google Inc. 's co-founders as his "best friends". "I believe Larry is ready" to be CEO, Eric Schmidt said during the call.
